one.name: Robert Boyle
one.description: Robert Boyle, natural philosopher, chemist, physicist, and inventor, largely regarded today as the first modern chemist.

two.name: Ernest Walton
two.description: Ernest Walton received the Novel Prize for splitting the atom.

three.name: Francis Beaufort
three.description: Beaufort invented the Beaufort scale to measure wind conditions.

four.name: Birr Castle
four.description: Birr Castle is the home of the Leviathan of Parsonstown, the largest telescope of the nineteenth century, built by the 3rd Earl of Rosse.

five.name: Blackrock Castle
five.description: Former castle guarding entrance to Cork harbour, now an educational observatory affiliated with Munster Technological University.

six.name: Ellen Hutchins
six.description: Ellen Hutchins (1785–1815) was an early Irish botanist. She specialised in seaweeds, lichens, mosses and liverworts.

seven.name: Guigielmo Marconi
seven.description: Guglielmo Marconi (1874–1937) was an Italian inventor and electrical engineer, known for his pioneering work on long-distance radio transmission, for which he shared the 1909 Nobel Prize in Physics for the development of wireless telegraphy.
